content.text: Sketch the graph of \(y = \left|3x - 2a\right|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant
It is given that \(z_{1} = r_{1}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{1}}\) and \(z_{2} = r_{2}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{2}}\)
\(z = 3\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) is a root of the equation \(z^{2} + bz + c = 0\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are real
State the other root and hence find the values of \(b\) and \(c\)
Find the gradients of the tangents to the curve when \(x = 0\)
The equation of a curve is \(xy + y^2\mathrm{e}^{-x} = 4.\)
Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z + 4}{z + 4\mathrm{i}}\) is real and \(|z| = \sqrt{10}\). Give your answers in the form \(z = x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\)
State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion in part **(b)** is valid
Let \(\mathrm {f}(x)=\frac {3a-5x}{(3a+2x)(2a-x)}\), where \(a\) is a positive constant
Hence solve the equation \(\cot^2 x - \tan^2 x = 5 \sec 2x\) for \(0^\circ < x < 90^\circ\)
The point \(P\) is the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\)
The point \(D\) is the reflection of \(A\) in \(l\)
With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by
Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\) and \(y\)
Given that \(0 < y < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), find the values of \(y\) when \(x = 0\)
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation
Show that if a sequence of values given by the iterative formula
Use the iterative formula in part **(c)** to calculate \(a\) correct to 4 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \sqrt{x} \sin 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x = a\)
